intro: Verticordia adenocalyx, commonly known as the red-stemmed banksia, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces bright red or orange flowers that are arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
